nsr.loui.playingcards.cards

Class Cards

  • java.lang.Object
    • nsr.loui.playingcards.cards.BaseCards
      • nsr.loui.playingcards.cards.Cards
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    OrderedCards, Trash, UnorderedCards

    public abstract class Cards
extends BaseCards
    This class is high-functioning than BaseCards. Usually you had better to use class that extends this.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • pickFrom

        public void pickFrom(Cards from,
                     int num)
              throws CardNotEnoughException
        Try to pick NUM cards from FROM to THIS. This method call BaseCards#pickFrom(BaseCards, IndividualCardImitator) internally.
        Parameters:
        from - where you want to pick card from.
        num - how many you want to pick.
        Throws:
        CardNotEnoughException - when from.countCard() < num.

      • divideFrom

        public void divideFrom(Cards from,
                       WildCardImitator wildPurpose)
        Draw cards from FROM what match WILD-PURPOSE condition. This method call BaseCards#pickFrom(BaseCards, IndividualCardImitator) internally.
        Parameters:
        from - where you want to divide from.
        wildPurpose - imitator indicate cards what you want to divide.

      • divideFrom

        public void divideFrom(Cards from,
                       WildCardImitator... wildPurposes)
        This method call divideFrom(WildCardImitator) for each WILD-PURPOSE.
        Parameters:
        from - where you want to divide from.
        wildPurposes - imitators indicate cards what you want to divide.
